column3: Your hypothesis space is a subset of the version space.
The target concept might not be represented by the hypothesis space.
The boosting algorithm can overfit if one of its base learners overfits.
The boosting algorithm tends not to overfit because it is a linear combination of many weak learners.
Bayesian Networks can represent AND, OR and XOR.
Bayesian Networks can represent boolean variables since a boolean variable has a 0-1 distribution.
As the amount of training data increases, the probability that the model overfits the training data increases. This will cause the training error to go down.
If the training data is noisy, a classifier trained on it could still overfit.
Boosting actually can have a lot of variance because it is a combination of many classifiers.
